resources.string: Fin Sim App
HALLE

Age: 20 
Occupation: Work Study at the University of Pennsylvania 
Location: Philadelphia, PA 
Relationship Status: Single 
Yearly Income: $4500 
You use public transportation to travel the city and are not a part of any relationships currently. You run every morning and maintain a healthy life-style. As a student, the largest issues you face are paying off your student debt and budgeting your money between food, housing, and fun. You have a work-study job where you make $8.15 an hour.
JIAMIN

Age: 35 
Occupation: Werizon Sales Representative 
Location: Columbus, Ohio. 
Relationship Status: Single 
Yearly Income: $45,000 
Your annual income is comfortable for a single woman with no kids, but not generous enough to afford vacations. In fact, you haven’t left the country for over a decade. You commute for 75 minutes every day to work in an old but reliable junker Honda Civic ‘95. You are seeking a relationship but as you grow older, you realize how much more difficult it is to make new friends and how easy it is to drift apart from old friends. You worry that your prime years have passed by.
LAUREN

Age: 42 
Occupation: Investment banker 
Location: NYC. 
Relationship Status: Married 
Yearly Income: $250,000 
You have three children, and own a car, boat, and vacation home. The biggest issue you face is that you have a very busy lifestyle and often lack social time with your family and friends.
SWETHA

Age: 75 
Occupation: Retired for 12 years 
Location: Fort Myers, Florida 
Relationship Status: Married 
Yearly Income: $0 
You have two grandchildren whom you love very much. You suffer from arthritis and cataracts, finding yourself restricted to the confines of your home more and more frequently as time passes. You have found that the lifestyle you have become accustomed to and your frequent health issues have led to your retirement fund depleting faster than you planned, which makes the future uncertain.
Your friends text you to go out the night before the exam. Do you...
Stay in and keep studying to make sure you ace the exam.
Go out to the bars and have a fun time with your friends to de-stress.
Compromise for a quick dinner out together.
Because you are dissatisfied, you decide it’s time for a change. Do you...
start searching for new jobs - costs $0 but risks your stable $45,000 salary
travel abroad - costs $1,500
go to Single’s Night at the Bar every Friday - Costs $30 every time
One of your children fell and broke his arm. Do you...
Take him to the hospital - with insurance, this will cost you $900
Make a makeshift cast at home - costs $10
Comfort him and hope it heals with time - costs $0
You want to take your grandchild out for her birthday but she wants to go to the mall. Do you...
Take her out and risk injury and fatigue - injury would cost $150
Suggest something less fun to do inside your house such as bake - Costs $15
Send her a card with money in it so she can buy whatever she wants - Costs $25
Your three figure student debt is accumulating. Do you...
Give up 10% of your paycheck every week to start paying it off the interest now - Costs $15 of your $160 weekly paycheck
Wait until you make a starting salary of $75,000 a year to pay off your debt after college -$0 right now, but will add up later on
Put it off until later and have your parents help you out
You try your hand at kids, you babysit your nephew. Do you...
Find raising kids too difficult and that it is not the lifestyle for you- Costs $0
Have a great time and realize you want to find someone to settle down with more than ever- Costs $30,000 for a wedding you will save for for 2 years with your partner
Realize you want to have a kid now and don’t have time to meet the right person - Costs $5,000 to adopt
You are offered a promotion at work that will increase your salary, but also increase the amount of time spent at work. Do you...
Take the job and the bonus that comes will it
Negotiate the offer to attain the higher position, but give up the bonus to have a more balanced schedule
Reject the offer
Your country club is hosting a Karaoke night that is out of your comfort zone but the winner gets a $50 gift card. Do you...
Not take the competition seriously as you have a fun time and are busy meeting new people
Take the competition seriously and win the competition
Stay home because socializing is difficult
Your scholarship requires a 3.4 GPA and a clean record. Do you...
Say no to going out to parties to ensure you never get caught and lose your scholarship - Costs $0
Lose track of time at the gym with your friends and forget to do homework - Costs $0
Find a balance between your academic and social life- physically taxing to keep up with
You decide to look into buying a stock in Werizon. Do you...
Take classes about the stock market to prepare your investments - Costs $600 for the class but you can make a profit of $1,000
Roll the dice and buy 3 shares at $60 each - Costs $180 but may profit
Do not invest any money in stocks
Your friends want to go out for the night, but you have to work. Do you...
Call in sick and take some much needed personal time
Cancel on your friends and work
Quit your job
A nigerian prince emails you asking for financial assistance. Do you...
Send him the money, I mean he is a Nigerian prince.
Take the competition seriously and win the competition
Stay home because socializing is difficult
